lead_paragraph: For the first time in modern history, adults ages 18 to 34 are more likely to live with a parent than with a romantic partner, a new report found.

headline.print_headline: Millennials’ No. 1 Roommates Are Their Parents
headline.main: Millennials’ Roommates Now More Likely to Be Parents Than Partners

snippet: For the first time in modern history, adults ages 18 to 34 are more likely to live with a parent than with a romantic partner, a new report found.
abstract: Analysis by Pew Research Center shows, for first time in modern history, young adults aged 18 to 34 are more likely to live with parent than romantic partner, with 32.1 percent living in parent's home as of 2014; shift reflects millennials' slower path to marriage and setting up household.
